summary: Defines a suite of modular neural‑network building blocks—encoders, decoders, bottleneck, classifier, dense convolutional stacks, and indexed skip connections—and assembles them into the QuickNAT architecture, a fully convolutional encoder‑decoder network for fast, accurate segmentation of neuroanatomical structures in medical images.
business_intent: Offer a configurable, ready‑to‑use implementation of the QuickNAT model that enables researchers and clinicians to automatically delineate brain regions in MRI scans, facilitating large‑scale neuroimaging studies, rapid diagnostic workflows, and optional uncertainty estimation.
